order sought preventing respondent from bringing further proceedings against the applicants and generally in this court without leave

vexatiousness a quality of the proceeding not the respondent's intention
test is whether a proceeding is so obviously untenable or manifestly groundless as to be utterly hopeless
question of whether respondent has instituted proceedings 'habitually, persistently and without reasonable grounds' not to be confused with whether proceeding is vexatious
requirements of o 21 rr 1 and 2 satisfied
